Pemerintah Sebar Insentif, Rasio Pajak Diklaim Bisa Naik ke 12,5%
06 Nov 2019, 04:20 by Danang Sugianto


Foto: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Rasio pajak merupakan tolak ukur untuk menilai kinerja perpajakan suatu negara. Indonesia sendiri rasio pajaknya baru berkisar 10-11%. Wakil Menteri Keuangan Suahasil Nazara mengatakan, sebenarnya rasio pajak Indonesia lebih tinggi dari itu. Sebab pemerintah sendiri sudah mendorong penarikan pajak dengan menyiapkan insentif perpajakan."Kita siapkan banyak insentif, baik di industri hulu yang kita harapkan industri hilirnya dapat manfaat. Kemudian industri hilir juga kita siapkan berbagai insentif," ujarnya dalam acara Indonesia Banking Expo 2019 di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta Selatan, Rabu (6/11/2019).Pada 2018, lanjut Suahasil, pemerintah secara total memberikan insentif ke seluruh dunia usaha sebanyak Rp 220 triliun. "Ini estimasi kita dari pembebasan pajak penghasilan, PPN tidak pungut, barang impor tidak dikenakan dan lain sebagainya," tambahnya.Suahasil menerangkan, insentif hingga Rp 220 triliun setara dengan 1,5% terhadap PDB. Angka itu menurutnya bisa menjadi penambah bagi rasio pajak."Kalau tax to GDP ratio 11% dan insentifnya 1,5% sebetulnya potensi tax to GDP kita bisa 12,5%," tambahnya.Simak Video "Blak-blakan Surya Tjandra: Bela Buruh dan Konflik Agraria"[Gambas:Video 20detik](das/ara)

Government Spreads Incentives, Claimed Tax Ratio Can Increase to 12.5%
Nov 6 2019, 04:20 by Danang Sugianto


Photo: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - The tax ratio is a benchmark to assess the performance of a country's taxation. Indonesia itself has only a tax ratio of around 10-11%. Deputy Minister of Finance Suahasil Nazara said that Indonesia's tax ratio was actually higher than that. "The government itself has encouraged tax collection by preparing tax incentives." We prepare a lot of incentives, both in the upstream industry that we hope the downstream industry can benefit from. Then we also prepare various downstream incentives, "he said at the Indonesia Banking Expo 2019 at the Fairmont Hotel , South Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). In 2018, continued Suahasil, the government in total gave incentives to the entire business world as much as Rp 220 trillion. "This is our estimation of income tax exemption, VAT is not collected, imported goods are not imposed and so forth," he added. As a result explained, incentives of up to Rp 220 trillion are equivalent to 1.5% of GDP. According to him, that figure could be an addition to the tax ratio. "If the tax to GDP ratio is 11% and the incentive is 1.5%, our potential tax to GDP could be 12.5%," he added.
